title.value: Quantum-Inspired Interpretable AI-Empowered Decision Support System for Detection of Early-Stage Rheumatoid Arthritis in Primary Care Using Scarce Dataset
title.justification: The title clearly states the main focus of the paper, which is about developing a decision support system for early detection of rheumatoid arthritis using AI and scarce datasets.
title.quote: Quantum-Inspired Interpretable AI-Empowered Decision Support System for Detection of Early-Stage Rheumatoid Arthritis in Primary Care Using Scarce Dataset

extractions.description: This paper presents a web-based decision support system designed to aid in the early detection of rheumatoid arthritis in primary care. Utilizing Sparse Fuzzy Cognitive Maps and a quantum-learning algorithm, the authors aim to address the challenges of diagnosing this condition using a limited dataset. The proposed system outperformed other machine learning models and highlights the importance of interpretabilit√© in AI for medical diagnosis.

type.justification: The paper involves the development and testing of an AI-powered decision support system for medical diagnosis, which involves experimental validation using datasets.
type.quote: We compared the results of our model with other machine learning methods (e.g., linear discriminant analysis, Support Vector Machines, and K-Nearest Neighbors).

name.justification: The paper focuses on using AI techniques to improve healthcare diagnosis, specifically targeting rheumatoid arthritis detection.
name.quote: We aim to develop a web-based Decision Support System (DSS) to provide a proper assistance for primary care providers in early detection of RA patients.

name.justification: The paper's primary application is in the medical field, aiming to detect early-stage rheumatoid arthritis.
name.quote: Early detection of RA in settings such as primary care (as the first contact with patients) can have an important role on the timely treatment of the disease.

name.justification: The paper employs machine learning techniques to build an interpretable AI decision support system.
name.quote: Using Sparse Fuzzy Cognitive Maps, as well as quantum-learning algorithm, we developed an online web-based DSS.

name.value: Sparse Fuzzy Cognitive Maps (SFCM) with Quantum Learning Algorithm
name.justification: The main model discussed in the paper that powers the AI decision support system.
name.quote: Using Sparse Fuzzy Cognitive Maps, as well as quantum-learning algorithm, we developed an online web-based DSS.

is_contributed.justification: The model is novel and was specifically developed and applied in the scope of this paper's research.
is_contributed.quote: In order to overcome the above-mentioned limitations, in this study we propose a novel method based on FCM and a quantum learning algorithm.

is_executed.justification: The model was executed as part of the web-based DSS to test its efficacy.
is_executed.quote: We aim to develop a web-based Decision Support System...

is_compared.justification: The model was compared to several other machine learning methods like SVM and KNN.
is_compared.quote: We compared the results of our model with other machine learning methods (e.g., linear discriminant analysis, Support Vector Machines, and K-Nearest Neighbors).

referenced_paper_title.value: Medical diagnosis of Rheumatoid Arthritis using data driven PSO-FCM with scarce datasets
referenced_paper_title.justification: The previous work referenced for using FCMs in RA diagnosis.
referenced_paper_title.quote: In the previous work [11], we designed a RA diagnosis decision support system by training a 10-node fully-connected Fuzzy Cognitive Map (FCM) and using a particle swarm optimization (PSO) algorithm.

name.value: Shohada University Hospital RA Patient Dataset
name.justification: A dataset from Shohada University Hospital was mentioned as being used in the study.
name.quote: To develop our web-based decision support system (DSS), we used a dataset with the information of 13 anonymous patients with RA who were randomly chosen from Shohada University Hospital in 2016.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not appear to reference another paper for this dataset.
